cultural.label: Our Heritage
cultural.paragraph1: Mithila, the ancient kingdom mentioned in the Ramayana, has nurtured an unbroken artistic tradition since the time of King Janaka. The women of this land have passed down the sacred art of Madhubani painting from mother to daughter for over five millennia.
cultural.paragraph2: Every motif tells a story — the fish symbolizes fertility, the peacock represents love, and the lotus embodies purity. These aren't just decorations; they're prayers painted with natural colors derived from turmeric, indigo, and the sacred earth of Mithila.
cultural.quote: When I paint, I don't just create art. I invoke my ancestors, their wisdom, their prayers. Every stroke carries their blessings.
cultural.quoteBy: — Bharti Dayal, National Award Winner, Jitwarpur
